alert.note: Alert for Monroe (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:36AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Roanoke, Pulaski, eastern Giles, Craig, Botetourt, northwestern Bedford, Montgomery and southeastern Monroe Counties, the City of Radford, the City of Salem and the City of Roanoke through 230 AM EDT... At 136 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huffman, or near Mountain Lake, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Blacksburg... Salem... Christiansburg... Radford... Pulaski... and Vinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
